intro: Gilia congesta var. merrillii, commonly known as the Merrill's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds in capsules that are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
